description.narrative: The Project is expected to have high economic and developmental impact in the following ways: 1) provision of critical infrastructure to support economic growth: the Project is expected to generate around 1,400 GWh of base-load power generation annually, or about 10% of the country's total generation, helping to meet increasing power demand driven by economic growth; 2) decreasing carbon emissions through the displacement of fossil-fuel powered generation.

The project consists in the development, construction and operation of a 305.5 MW hydropower generation plant (the Project) in the Reventazón river basin located in Siquirres, province of Limón, Costa Rica. The construction process has started and the Project is expected to start operations in 2016. The Project is expected to generate around 1,400 GWh annually, on average, once operational; representing around 10% of the energy expected to be produced in Costa Rica by then. The Project will be developed through a special purpose vehicle (Fideicomiso Reventazón or the Trust, a Costa Rican trust). The Trust is expected to lease the Project to Instituto Costarricense de Electricidad (ICE) when operational.

name.narrative: The Project is located 8 kilometers southeast of the city of Siquirres, province of Limón (Caribbean side of Costa Rica). The Projects surrounding area is largely fragmented with pastures, farms, forestry plantations, roads, towns, and communities. The Project is accessible from the capital of Costa Rica (San José) via existing highway and road infrastructure and Project access routes.
